tit.e: Kurodo no to (the name of a post)

sen.j: 蔵人頭（くろうどのとう）とは、令外官の役職で、蔵人所の実質的な長（名目的な長官は他に「蔵人別当」と呼んで大臣が兼任していた）。
sen.e: "Kurodo no to" was a post of "Ryoge no kan" (class outside of the Ritsuryo system) and the virtual head of Kurododokoro (the Chamberlain's Office) (the nominal head was called Kurodo-betto the post of which a minister also assumed).

"Kurodo no to" was a post of "Ryoge no kan" (class outside of the Ritsuryo system) and the virtual head of Kurododokoro (the Chamberlain's Office) (the nominal head was called Kurodo-betto the post of which a minister also assumed).

The Kurodo no to, an official position outside of the Ritsuryo system (these positions were known as Ryoge no kan), was effectively the head of the Kurodo dokoro (chamberlain's office) (the nominal head, also known as the Kurodo betto, was also a minister).

sen.j: 勅旨や上奏を伝達する役目を受け持つなど、天皇の秘書的役割を果たした。
sen.e: Handling Imperial papers and conveying statements to Emperor, "Kurodo no to" played the role that was something like a secretary to Emperor.

sen.j: 通常、四位の者が補任されるが、官位相当は無い。
sen.e: Ordinarily, a person in Shii (the fourth rank) was appointed to "Kurodo no to" but was provided with no official court rank

sen.j: 蔵人頭は殿上における席次も、上の位階の殿上人よりも上座とされ、首席に座を占めることになっていた。
sen.e: Concerning the order of seats in the Imperial court, that of "Kurodo no to" was higher than tenjobito (high-ranking courtiers allowed into the Imperial Palace) who were ranked above "Kurodo no to," occupying the top of the seats.

sen.e: For this reason, he was also called kanzu (a leader).

sen.j: 大同 (日本)5年（810年）、蔵人所の設置に伴い、初代の蔵人頭に藤原冬嗣と巨勢野足が任命された。
sen.e: In 810 when Kurododokoro was established, FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu and KOSE no Notari were appointed to the first "Kurodo no to" posts.

sen.e: Corresponding to Fuyutsugu's success in his carrier, "Kurodo no to" became to be assigned to Sangi (councilor) immediately when the sangi post became available.

sen.j: 公卿への昇進への登竜門ともいえる役職となった。
sen.e: Therefore, "Kurodo no to" became a post that could be said to be a gateway to a court noble.

sen.j: 2名の蔵人頭は武官である近衛中将と、文官である弁官の弁官または弁官から1名ずつ選ばれることが多かった。
sen.e: Of the two "Kurodo no to" posts, one was assigned mostly to a person at the "Konoe no chujo" post, a post for military officers、 and another to a person at the Benkan post, a post for civil officers.
